title: Okay I really need a Rioter to explain this one to me..

embed.description: Today's red post collection includes details on an extra PBE patch coming in December, a new Ask Riot covering Runeterran religion & LeBlanc, as well as All-Star icons, full details on the All-Star event, and more! Continue reading for more information!

body: If you have a champion such as Leblanc, who you guys admit didn't hit the mark, why move onto another champion? What if the next champion misses the mark, now you have 2 champions who are in a weird state.. I thought you guys learned from the assassin update that "class updates" are bad and rushed. How is this any different? It's like you want to update every champion before actually making the one's you have accessed "correct".. Please for the love of God don't be in such a hurry to fix everything at once.. Do a good job and show the community you care about their interest in their mains.

replies.body: He says right in his answer that they are going to do small scale tuning to her current kit to put her in a better spot and try and make her a bit more like old LB while satisfying the people that like playing her rework. They don't want to rush full kit changes and end up making a third version of LeBlanc that just ends up pissing off everyone that played both the original and reworked versions.

Yes, but she's not the only one..

> we’re opting to table further Leblanc rework explorations for now as we **focus our efforts on systems and _champs that need more urgent attention_ **(ie. Runes Reforged follow-up).

These champions better be ones like Rengar, Akali, Fizz, Shaco etc.. because again, i don't like the idea of moving on before fixing something they messed up.

More often then not, if the solution is not clear, trying to fix something they messed up is going to make things much worse. Things flow side by side, not one after another. When a designer is done, they move on to the next thing. That is done before they have a good clear idea if the design has failed or not. Fixing their problems then would either require a new designer who came off another project simultaneously, slowing the release process, or pulling the old designer off his current work, delaying the process even more and potentially screwing up the fix again due to not having had a clear idea of the solution.

Why do you think they should do Rengar again? If anything, he was stronger before and had easier acces to his damage with double, even tripple Q. The only problem I see with Rengar atm is duskblade but it's not strong only on Rengar tho, a lot of champions abuse that item so hard, even ADCs.

I just don't find him as satisfying to play .. not nearly.. I miss aa resetting esp after landing from leap. (leap land reset with Q) i liked the old fero system, it made managing it somewhat fun and interesting. I miss tiamat being a core part of his kit. I don't like the way Q looks, or that it's this weird 2 set skillshot. I don't like that his ult indicator for finding a target is just as good for those avoiding him.. Its annoying, he's not a hunter anymore, he's a madman who swings his blades around and rawrs before he ults.

From day 1 of PBE when i played Rengar i felt super superrrrr clunky. sure i've goten more use to it over the year, but its def not fluid by any stretch. From day 1, i knew his clunky kit would be compensated by the sheer power of his bonetooth neckless..

Idc if Rengar is better or worse.. He's not as fun to play before and that's the reason i log onto league.. for fun.

I find him somewhat balanced at his current state but yes, I agree hes not as fun to play as he used to be. His Q animation is weird AF and I find old one more satisfying and more ferocious. As for his ult detection range idk what to say, they can see that indicator but still, he gets that move speed buff to outrunn them. I like his new W tho.
balance =/= fun I'd take the 46% winrate Rengar over any 50% + with this kit.

Why do you want them to rush work on Leblanc though? They literally said “we had some ideas but they didn’t turn out very good, and right now we don’t have any ideas for her.” Trying to force something out without having a good plan for it is the very definition of rushing. You say you don’t want them to rush through everything, but you want them to rush through designing Leblanc and possibly make her even worse?
Its been over a year my dude... There is nothing rushed about it.
Right, and they were working on her. They said that. But when they tested the changes, they didn't turn out as well as hoped. That happens in game design sometimes, it's an iterative process.

PFFTHAHAHAHAHAHAHA

Oh, man.

Buddy ol' pal, if Riot wanted to show people they have a vested interest in their mains, Leblanc is NOT where they need to be starting. She's had plenty of time to shine.
I don't even know what you are trying to say..

I imagine that LB was a powerhouse mid for so long that it is indeed time to work on those who have been crippled for far longer.

LB was part of a class update. The champions they're doing now are 1 at a time (except Morg and Kayle I think will be shipped together). LB will get her small Azir/Xin style rework soon enough, but right now they have bigger problems. LB can stay in the ground for a couple more patches, yes it sucks for LB mains and players (I'd love to be able to play one of my favorite champs again but oh well, I got other champs to play and work on). I mean Poppy was the definition of a champion who was too powerful for her time so she had to be purposely nerfed into the ground so she wouldn't dominate games untll they could rework her. 

I think we can wait another 2-4 patches for LB to get some love, it's not like she's awful atm, just not that great.
Who said getting work would make her stronger though? ..  Thats not the complaint.

And that's also not his only point. She has been worked on recently, there are such champs that didn't recieve any work at all and deserve not to be abandoned. Not that I'd fully disagree with you or agree with him, but that's what he tried to explain.

He isnt saying abandon them he is saying finish fixing her. When riot said they were going to rework a champion they stuck to the road map eve, xin, and urgot all got satisfying reworks. However each time they keep putting of lb like it cannot be done or something. Like they dont actually have a solution so they say lets just go to the next champion. So in a real sense it seems like they are abandoning LB really at this point. Just finish the job they started that's all he is saying.
Some of us wish our champion didn't get work.. so yeah i'd trade that.

-Zac had to get nerfed into the ground because of the sheer ridiculous power of his new ult. He should be given back his old ult and his numbers.

-Malphite is only powerful right now because of a specific rune, and up until the new runes hit was in a terrible place. Either way, he's in need of some serious love.

-Voli's still a walking stat stick, just like he has been pretty much since release.

-Fiddlesticks is severely outdated and barely functions in a world where vision is relatively easy to set down and mobility is the king of everything.

What I'm trying to say is, Leblanc might need help. She does NOT need to go to the front of that particular line, however, because there are plenty of champions who needed more help than her _before she was even updated at all._ Riot had higher priorities the entire time. They didn't focus on those priorities then, and giving LB extra attention over them _again_ would just be Ryze all over again. Too much attention paid to one champion that wasn't in the worst place and shouldn't have been first in line for help.

He's saying LB may suck right now, but she has had stretches where she's been very powerful, and with there being champions like Aatrox, for example, they should start somewhere else if they're looking into fixing champions that people main.

As a designer in training, I can kinda speak to this. Basically, sometimes you design something that you think is great and you've ironed out the issues but it somehow missed the mark. Sometimes it's easy like an "Oh, DUH!" kind of moment, and you can tweak it almost immediately and have a new iteration overnight that solves it all. 

Sometimes though it's hard; it's the kind of thing where by all rights what you did should have worked perfectly and you're stumped how to resolve the issues you misunderstood or didn't foresee. 

When that's the case, it takes time to reach a resolution, and in a company, reinvesting that kind of time can be pretty costly, so a sacrifice has to be made, and that item becomes a lower priority until someone reaches some new insight in how to resolve the problem.

Also, there are times when it's simply a matter of fixing that which seems the easiest to resolve for the least investment at the time, and tackling the harder stuff more gradually with spare resources until you can delegate enough effort to fully fix the issue in one go.

It's also probably better that a different designer works on it for a different perspective. Sometimes, certain design philosophies of individual designers just don't gel with the community. Especially for characters who already exist.

They also can't just keep working on the same champ over and over again when other champs are in   desperate need of work done. That's how we end up with champs like Ryze who just constantly get updated and miss the mark while champs like Nunu have to wait behind them cause "We'll get it right this time for sure". 
There are over 130 champs and a good portion of them need some form of work done. They already mentioned that they are at least TRYING to make sure that her next update will do her justice. Some of us are not anywhere near as lucky.
Dude i agree, thats why they should of just left them alone to begin with, because they clearly missed the mark.

A lot of time when things get iceboxed, or put on hold, it's because they can't think of a solid direction. It's not a simple "If we work X hours, we'll find a solution". 

Can't find a source, but I'm confident in my info that they tried a Leblanc rework idea, but what came out didn't feel like Leblanc, but felt like it could be used on a future champion, so they scrapped it. It's why Yorick took so long to come out for his VGU, they just never found a solid core concept for him to flesh out.
They also never found one for Leblanc or Rengar, which is why they both need to be revised .. again.
Yeah, when they can find a direction to work on.
They shouldn't of touched them in the first place if they didn't have a direction.
I mean, they did at the time, but obviously it didn't work out, just not because they didn't feel like Rengar or Leblanc. There's a reason they're no longer doing Class reworks anymore.

> If you have a champion such as Leblanc, who you guys admit didn't hit the mark, why move onto another champion?

For starts, they have more than one team. You can easily have one group doing one champion and another looking at a different champion.


> What if the next champion misses the mark?

You can't live in fear like that or you'll accomplish nothing. They move on because that's what you do- learn from your failures and try again later. Imagine if they stuck on Ryze every time because they couldn't quite figure him out? There'd be something like half a year dedicated JUST to fixing Ryze. This is the better path in the overall scheme of things I think.


> Do a good job and show the community you care about their interest in their mains.

Considering how frequently Rioters insist they're losing sleep and arguing with one another about what they're doing or how they're doing it- it's hardly a lack of care that's the issue.
You cant halt the release of new champions and other reworks to rework 5 failed assasins 4 of which are just going to get some small tweaks.

>What if the next champion misses the mark, now you have 2 champions who are in a weird state..

It's a lot more than two champions. And don't think Riot ever really did learn their lesion from the assassin rework.

Still waiting on that yi / yasuo rework they talked about
https://australia4mpe.files.wordpress.com/2015/09/billy-bones-waiting1.jpg?w=400&h=400

I look at riot's development projects like a queue. The first one in is the first one out. If they screw up a project, they will have to put it back into a queue and continue working on other things. Once the failed project is next in line of work, Riot will work on it. Else, it will have to wait until its turn comes.
